name: ccusage
title: Claude Code Usage (ccusage)
description: Monitor Claude Code usage with real-time tracking
author: nyatinte

commands.name: ccusage
commands.title: Claude Code Usage
commands.subtitle: ccusage
commands.description: Monitor Claude Code usage with real-time tracking

commands.name: menubar-ccusage
commands.title: Claude Code Usage in Menu Bar
commands.subtitle: ccusage
commands.description: Show Claude Code usage in menu bar

preferences.name: defaultView
preferences.title: Default View
preferences.description: Choose the default section to display when opening the extension

preferences.name: customNpxPath
preferences.title: Custom npx Path
preferences.description: Override the default npx path if needed (optional)

tools.name: get-daily-usage
tools.title: Get Daily Usage
tools.description: Get today's Claude Code usage including cost, tokens, and statistics

tools.name: get-total-usage
tools.title: Get Total Usage
tools.description: Get comprehensive Claude Code usage statistics including totals, sessions, and model breakdowns

tools.name: get-monthly-usage
tools.title: Get Monthly Usage
tools.description: Get current month's Claude Code usage statistics and model breakdowns

tools.name: get-session-usage
tools.title: Get Session Usage
tools.description: Get detailed session-by-session Claude Code usage statistics

ai.instructions: Analyze Claude Code usage statistics and costs. All cost values are in USD ($). When displaying costs, include the $ symbol. Focus on providing accurate usage metrics and cost analysis.

evals.description: Should call get-daily-usage tool to retrieve today's statistics
Should call get-monthly-usage tool with model breakdown information

evals.prompt: How many sessions did I have recently?
evals.description: Should call get-session-usage tool to show recent session data

evals.prompt: What's my total usage across all time?
evals.description: Should call get-total-usage tool for comprehensive statistics

scripts.prepublishOnly:
echo "

It seems like you are trying to publish the Raycast extension to npm.

If you did intend to publish it to npm, remove the \`prepublishOnly\` script and rerun \`npm publish\` again.
If you wanted to publish it to the Raycast Store instead, use \`npm run publish\` instead.

" && exit 1
